Boston.com
10

Petraeus quits CIA director post over extramarital affair

David Petraeus said in a statement that he had shown ‘‘extremely poor judgment’’ in having an affair. He asked President Obama on Thursday to allow him to resign, and on Friday the president accepted. (AP, 3:16 p.m.)

Judge delays James 'Whitey' Bulger trial

US District Judge Richard Stearns rejected a defense motion to delay the trial by eight months, but agreed to put it off from March until June. (Globe , 3:12 p.m.)
  • 11/7 Marshals: Mass. mobster out of hospital, in jail
  • 11/1 Judge mulling whether to delay Bulger trial

How far can $800,000 go in Boston? That largely depends on where you want to live in the city. Here's a look at what's out there from 955 to 5,076 square feet.

President Obama, Boehner offer rival plans for skirting 'fiscal cliff'

President Obama proposed letting the tax cuts for the rich expire while House Speaker John Boehner said all the cuts should be extended for a year. (Globe, 1:44 p.m.)
  • Transcript of Obama's remarks | Firms fear 'fiscal cliff'
  • Graphic US cutbacks | Congress grapples with cuts
  • Tax impasse a hurdle | Congress: Cuts mean recession

Landlord group seeks to opt out of Massachusetts medical marijuana law

The Small Property Owners Association wants to know whether landlords could run afoul of federal law if they let people grow pot in rental properties. (Globe , 2:31 p.m.)
  • What do doctors need to know about medical pot?

Former US Rep. Joseph D. Early Sr. dies at age 79

Worcester Democrat Joseph D. Early Sr., who represented Massachusetts in Congress from 1975 to 1993, died this morning. (Telegram, 2:07 p.m.)

Gas rationing begins in NYC

A gasoline rationing plan that lets motorists fill up every other day went into effect in New York on Friday, as utility crews made some progress erasing outages that put thousands of new homes and businesses.
